org.apache.river.test.share

Class LocatorsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.test.share.LocatorsUtil

  • public class LocatorsUtil
extends Object
    This class contains a set of static methods that provide general-purpose functions for processing sets of locators; functions such as displaying the contents of one or more locator sets, comparing the contents of two such sets, etc.
    See Also:
    QAConfig

    • Method Detail

      • displayLocatorSet

        public static void displayLocatorSet(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locators,
                                     String locatorSetName,
                                     Level level)
        Using an instance of org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestUtil, displays the contents of the input array whose elements are instances of net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator. The contents of that array will be displayed only if the QATestUtil instance is configured to display debugging output (qautil.debug=true).
        Parameters:
        locators - LookupLocator array containing the locator instances that are to be displayed
        locatorSetName - identifying String that will be displayed along with the contents of the array. This parameter can contain any value, even null, but will typically be set to the name of the array whose contents will be displayed. If null is input, the default String "locators" will be used.
        level - the logging level

      • displayLocatorSet

        public static void displayLocatorSet(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locators,
                                     Level level)
        Displays the contents of the input array whose elements are instances of net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator.

      • displayLocator

        public static void displayLocator(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator locator,
                                  String locatorName,
                                  Level level)
        Using an instance of org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestUtil, displays the given instance of the locator class net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator. The indicated instance of LookupLocator will be displayed only if the QATestUtil instance is configured to display debugging output (qautil.debug=true).
        Parameters:
        locator - LookupLocator instance referencing the locator information that is to be displayed
        locatorName - identifying String that will be displayed along with the locator information. This parameter can contain any value, even null, but will typically be set to the name of the object that will be displayed. If null is input, the default String "locator" will be used.

      • displayLocator

        public static void displayLocator(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator locator,
                                  Level level)
        Displays the given instance of the locator class net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator.

      • compareLocatorSets

        public static boolean compareLocatorSets(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locatorSet1,
                                         net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locatorSet2,
                                         Level level)
        Compares the contents of two sets of locators ignoring duplicate locators. If debugging is turned on (qautil.debug=true), this method uses an instance of org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestUtil to display information about the two sets being compared. This method should be invoked by tests that need to compare two sets of locators for equivalent content in which duplicate locators are unimportant.
        Parameters:
        locatorSet1 - LookupLocator array containing the first set of locator instances that are to be compared
        locatorSet2 - LookupLocator array containing the second set of locator instances that are to be compared
        Returns:
        true if the locator sets are equivalent

      • getLocatorsWithDups

        public static net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] getLocatorsWithDups(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locators)
                                                                   throws MalformedURLException
        Constructs a set of locators that contains elements which duplicate other elements in the set, as well as one or more of the locators contained in the locators parameter. This method is useful for constructing a set of locators with which to attempt locator addition, replacement, and removal, in which the existence of duplicate elements is important.
        Parameters:
        locators - array of instances of the class net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator in which the set of locators returned by this method will contain one or more of the elements of this set
        Returns:
        an array of net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator in which at least one element duplicates other element(s) in the set, and at least one element duplicates at least one of the locators contained in the locators parameter.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - this exception occurs when while attempting to construct instances of LookupLocator

      • getSubset

        public static net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] getSubset(net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator[] locators)
                                                         throws MalformedURLException
        Constructs a set of locators that is a sub-set of the locators parameter. This method is useful for constructing a set of locators with which to attempt locator manipulation (in particular removal), in which a sub-set of a particular set of locators is important.
        Parameters:
        locators - array of instances of the class net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator in which the set of locators returned by this method will be a sub-set of the locators parameter
        Returns:
        an array of net.jini.core.discovery.LookupLocator which is a sub-set of the set of locators referenced by the locators parameter.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - this exception occurs when while attempting to construct instances of LookupLocator

      • getLocatorUrl

        public static String getLocatorUrl(QAConfig config,
                                   int index)
        Given an index value, retrieves the port on which a lookup service corresponding to that index has been (or will be) started; then constructs and returns the locator url using that port and the local hostname. If the index value is zero and no port item with that index exists in the resource configuration file, then this method will attempt to retrieve the prot item with no index.
        Parameters:
        config - instance of the QAConfig class through which the port will be retrieved
        index - the index value of the particular configuration item to retrieve
        Returns:
        String representing the locator url constructed from the retrieved port corresponding to the value of the index parameter

      • getLocatorUrl

        public static String getLocatorUrl(QAConfig config)
        Retrieves the port with which a lookup service corresponding to the 'port' configuration item having no index has been (or will be) started. If there is no such configuration item, this method attempts the retrieval using an index value of zero.
        Parameters:
        config - instance of the QAConfig class through which the port will be retrieved
        Returns:
        String representing the locator url constructed from the retrieved port
